answers.author: Derek Johnson
answers.text:
Thomas,
There are numerous examples of strategic planning RFP's that can be found with a quick Google search. Here are a few:
City of Inglewood, Los Angelos
http://www.google.com/url?sa=t&source=web&cd=2&ved=0CBoQFjAB&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.cityofinglewood.org%2Fpdfs%2FRFP_Inglewood_Strategic_Pan_v.2.pdf&rct=j&q=strategic%20plan%20RFP&ei=J_qpTIKhHYGKlweT642QDQ&usg=AFQjCNFb-ZuRogedwyw-hh8mqzH1PDBUvQ&sig2=ABch-SGFi6BTEv81bqRddw&cad=rja
Hyattsville, Maryland
http://www.google.com/url?sa=t&source=web&cd=8&ved=0CDUQFjAH&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.hyattsville.org%2FDocumentView.aspx%3FDID%3D608&rct=j&q=strategic%20plan%20RFP&ei=J_qpTIKhHYGKlweT642QDQ&usg=AFQjCNFwL2-jDDIeVN6hpny12C6jlUdU3w&sig2=GD_aAYB0PftkG8CIRLu0zg&cad=rja
Lake Forest Park, Washington
http://www.google.com/url?sa=t&source=web&cd=22&ved=0CBsQFjABOBQ&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.cityoflfp.com%2Fmayor%2Fsustain-lfp%2F3_Establishing-the-TaskForce%2F2_RFP%2FRFPfinal101703.pdf&rct=j&q=strategic%20plan%20RFP&ei=5f2pTIOzBIK8lQe6npSMDQ&usg=AFQjCNGgI2Kd2TF9j1e-LywzZ2AkIkmDIA&sig2=zwkussFwNF1X_jJbZ_naIw&cad=rja
As you can see, the depth and detail of an RFP for a strategic plan can vary, depending on how specific or targeted a locality wishes to be. Many more examples can be found by typing "Strategic Plan RFP" into a number of mainstream search engines. 
As for general grant-related RFP guidelines, here is an excellent training manual put out by the Philadelphia School District on the matter. It addresses issues such as when RFPs' are appropriate, advantages/disadvantages of employing an RFP, tips on conducting the evaluation process and more. It also offers links to guidelines for issuing RFPs' and a general RFP template that you can view to give you a general idea of how they are constructed:
http://www.phila.k12.pa.us/offices/procurement/rfp-guidelines.htm
Hope this helps get you started!
Derek Johnson


Thomas,

There are numerous examples of strategic planning RFP's that can be found with a quick Google search. Here are a few:

City of Inglewood, Los Angelos
http://www.google.com/url?sa=t&source=web&cd=2&ved=0CBoQFjAB&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.cityofinglewood.org%2Fpdfs%2FRFP_Inglewood_Strategic_Pan_v.2.pdf&rct=j&q=strategic%20plan%20RFP&ei=J_qpTIKhHYGKlweT642QDQ&usg=AFQjCNFb-ZuRogedwyw-hh8mqzH1PDBUvQ&sig2=ABch-SGFi6BTEv81bqRddw&cad=rja

Lake Forest Park, Washington
http://www.google.com/url?sa=t&source=web&cd=22&ved=0CBsQFjABOBQ&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.cityoflfp.com%2Fmayor%2Fsustain-lfp%2F3_Establishing-the-TaskForce%2F2_RFP%2FRFPfinal101703.pdf&rct=j&q=strategic%20plan%20RFP&ei=5f2pTIOzBIK8lQe6npSMDQ&usg=AFQjCNGgI2Kd2TF9j1e-LywzZ2AkIkmDIA&sig2=zwkussFwNF1X_jJbZ_naIw&cad=rja

As you can see, the depth and detail of an RFP for a strategic plan can vary, depending on how specific or targeted a locality wishes to be. Many more examples can be found by typing "Strategic Plan RFP" into a number of mainstream search engines. 

As for general grant-related RFP guidelines, here is an excellent training manual put out by the Philadelphia School District on the matter. It addresses issues such as when RFPs' are appropriate, advantages/disadvantages of employing an RFP, tips on conducting the evaluation process and more. It also offers links to guidelines for issuing RFPs' and a general RFP template that you can view to give you a general idea of how they are constructed:

http://www.phila.k12.pa.us/offices/procurement/rfp-guidelines.htm

Hope this helps get you started!

Derek Johnson

author: Thomas Hoover
text:
I would like to obtain sample Requests for Proposals to obtain consultants' help for the following:

To develop a strategic plan for my community
To apply for, receive and administer grants in all areas of local government
title: Strategic Plans and Grants - RFP's
